alert.note: Alert for Northern Humboldt Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 30 at 10:14AM PST until January 31 at 1:00PM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: .A strong atmospheric river is expected to bring heavy rain Tuesday evening through early Thursday morning bringing six to ten inches of rainfall across the area. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of northwest California, including the following area, Northern Humboldt Coast. * WHEN...From late tonight through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...There will be an increased risk of rock and land slides along roadways. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. This may include Jacoby Creek at Old Arcata Road, the Hookton off ramp by Loleta and the Elk River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Two to four inches of rain is expected late tonight through Wednesday night. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
